answerText: Auger effect[10] Another process that can result in emitting an electron is this one in which K shell electrons couple to an excited nucleus and are given enough energy to pop out of the atom.
heading: DEES |2014 | Editors 2 | 5 | Science | Physics | College
subject: Science
question: Question: Charge carrier recombination can cause a type of this effect which is responsible for efficiency droop in LEDs.  [10] Name this three-particle effect that occurs when the energy formed from an electron recombining with a hole in an atom kicks a different electron out from the atom.
